qas.question: When did Johann Grueber cross Tibet on the way to Nepal?
When did Jesuit Father Ippolito Desideri spend time in Tibet?
How was Christianity used by some Tibetan monarchs?

answers.text: counterbalance the influence of the Gelugpa sect

qas.question: Who crossed Nepal before heading to Tibet in 1661?
Who remained in Tibet after building a church in Sining from 1716-1721?

context: In <a0_0>1661<a0_0/> another Jesuit, <b3_0>Johann Grueber<b3_0/>, crossed Tibet from Sining to Lhasa (where he spent a month), before heading on to Nepal. He was followed by others who actually built a church in Lhasa. These included the <b4_0>Jesuit Father Ippolito Desideri<b4_0/>, <a1_0>1716–1721<a1_0/>, who gained a deep knowledge of Tibetan culture, language and Buddhism, and various Capuchins in 1707–1711, 1716–1733 and 1741–1745, Christianity was used by some Tibetan monarchs and their courts and the Karmapa sect lamas to <a2_0>counterbalance the influence of the Gelugpa sect<a2_0/> in the 17th century until in 1745 when <b5_0>all the missionaries were expelled<b5_0/> at <b6_0>the lama<b6_0/>'s insistence.
